body:
> It looks like an RC2 implementation would also have to be pulled in, which is fine, although it should probably be a subpackage of the PKCS#12 packageâ€”hopefully PKCS#12 is the last thing in the world that needs it.
> - @agl

@dgryski: would it be possible for you to contribute the RC2 code to the pkcs12 repo, so that I can contribute it to x/crypto? It would require a [Microsoft CLA](https://cla.microsoft.com/) if you don't have one yet (much like contributing to Go requires a Google CLA).
Alternatively you can contribute your rc2 package to the x/crypto repo first and I'll follow with the pkcs12 package. I'd even prefer that, but I'm not sure how that works if rc2 is to be a subpackage of the pkcs12 package?
